The complex conjugate of <math display="inline">z = x  +  iy</math> is the number <math display="inline">\overline{z}=x  -  iy</math>, geometrically this reflects along the <math display="inline">x</math> axis.

Conjugating twice leaves us where we started so <math display="inline">\overline{\overline{z}} = \overline{x  -  iy}= x + iy = z</math> (it is an involution)
